# Introduction

Aim: Explore the clinical and genomic data from the METABRIC database of breast cancer

1\. Determine which clinical variables drives death of cancer

2\. Determine which genes are significant to death of cancer

3\. Determine which gene mutations are most abundant in breast cancer.

# Conclusion

-   Age has an impact on death

-   Tumor size might be related to death

-   Chemotherapy is likely used on more progressive cancer

-   Gene expression drives hormone expression

-   pik3ca, tp53, muc16 and ahnak2 are the most frequently mutated genes in breast cancer
